verses.verse: I will stand<WH5975> upon my watch<WH4931>, and set<WH3320> me upon the tower<WH4692>, and will watch<WH6822> to see<WH7200> what he will say<WH1696> unto me<WH7725>, and what I shall answer when I am reproved<WH8433>.
And the Lord<WH3068> answered<WH6030> me<WH559>, and said, Write<WH3789> the vision<WH2377>, and make it plain<WH874> upon tablets<WH3871>, that he may run<WH7323> that reads it<WH7121>.

For the vision<WH2377> is yet for a appointed time<WH4150>, but at the end<WH7093> it shall speak<WH6315>, and not lie<WH3576>: though it waits<WH4102>, wait<WH2442> for it<WH935>; because it will surely come<WH935>, it will not delay<WH309>.
Behold<WH5315>, his soul which is lifted up<WH6075> is not upright<WH3474> in him<WH6662>: but the just shall live<WH2421> by his faith<WH530>.

Yes also<WH898>, because he transgresses by wine<WH3196>, he is a proud<WH3093> man<WH1397>, neither keeps at home<WH5115>, who enlarges<WH7337> his desire<WH5315> as hell<WH7585>, and is as death<WH4194>, and cannot be satisfied<WH7646>, but gathers<WH622> unto him all nations<WH1471>, and heaps<WH6908> unto him all people<WH5971>:

Shall not all these take up<WH5375> a parable<WH4912> against him<WH4426>, and a taunting proverb<WH2420> against him<WH559>, and say, Woe<WH1945> to him that increases<WH7235> that which is not his<WH3513>! how long? and to him that loads himself with heavy pledges<WH5671>!
Shall they not rise up<WH6965> suddenly<WH6621> that shall bite<WH5391> you<WH3364>, and awake that shall trouble<WH2111> you<WH4933>, and you shall be for plunder to them?

Because you have spoiled<WH7997> many<WH7227> nations<WH1471>, all the remnant<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> shall plunder<WH7997> you<WH120>; because of men's blood<WH1818>, and for the violence<WH2555> of the land<WH776>, of the city<WH7151>, and of all that live in it<WH3427>.

Woe<WH1945> to him that covets<WH1214> a evil<WH7451> covetousness<WH1215> to his house<WH1004>, that he may set<WH7760> his nest<WH7064> on high<WH4791>, that he may be delivered<WH5337> from the power<WH3709> of evil<WH7451>!
You have consulted<WH3289> shame<WH1322> to your house<WH1004> by cutting off<WH7096> many<WH7227> people<WH5971>, and have sinned<WH2398> against your soul<WH5315>.
For the stone<WH68> shall cry out<WH2199> of the wall<WH7023>, and the log out<WH3714> of the timber<WH6086> shall answer it<WH6030>.
Woe<WH1945> to him that builds<WH1129> a town<WH5892> with blood<WH1818>, and establishes<WH3559> a city<WH7151> by iniquity<WH5766>!

Behold<WH3068>, is it not of the Lord of hosts<WH6635> that the people<WH5971> shall labor<WH3021> in the very<WH1767> fire<WH784>, and the people<WH3816> shall weary<WH3286> themselves for very<WH1767> vanity<WH7385>?
For the earth<WH776> shall be filled<WH4390> with the knowledge<WH3045> of the glory<WH3519> of the Lord<WH3068>, as the waters<WH4325> cover<WH3680> the sea<WH3220>.

Woe<WH1945> unto him that gives his neighbor<WH7453> drink<WH8248>, that empties<WH5596> your bottle<WH2573> to him<WH7937>, and makes him drunk also<WH5027>, that you may look on his nakedness<WH4589>!

You are filled<WH7646> with shame<WH7036> for glory<WH3519>: drink<WH8354> you also<WH6188>, and let your foreskin be uncovered: the cup<WH3563> of the Lord<WH3068>'s right hand<WH3225> shall be turned<WH5437> unto you<WH7022>, and shameful spewing shall be on your glory<WH3519>.

For the violence<WH2555> of Lebanon<WH3844> shall cover<WH3680> you<WH7701>, and the plunder of animals<WH929>, which made them afraid<WH2865>, because of men<WH120>'s blood<WH1818>, and for the violence<WH2555> of the land<WH776>, of the city<WH7151>, and of all that live in it<WH3427>.

What profits<WH3276> the engraved image<WH6459> that the maker<WH3335> there has engraved<WH6458> it<WH4541>; the molten image, and a teacher<WH3384> of lies<WH8267>, that the maker<WH3335> of his work<WH3336> trusts<WH982> in it<WH6213>, to make mute<WH483> idols<WH457>?

Woe<WH1945> unto him that says<WH559> to the wood<WH6086>, Awake<WH6974>; to the mute<WH1748> stone<WH68>, Arise<WH5782>, it shall teach<WH3384>! Behold<WH8610>, it is laid over with gold<WH2091> and silver<WH3701>, and there is no breath<WH7307> at all in the midst of it<WH7130>.
But the Lord<WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964>: let all the earth<WH776> keep silence<WH2013> before him<WH6440>.
